verses.verse: My son <WH1121>, attend <WH7181> <WH8685> unto my wisdom <WH2451>, and bow <WH5186> <WH8685> thine ear <WH241> to my understanding <WH8394>:
That thou mayest regard <WH8104> <WH8800> discretion <WH4209>, and that thy lips <WH8193> may keep <WH5341> <WH8799> knowledge <WH1847>.
For the lips <WH8193> of a strange woman <WH2114> <WH8801> drop <WH5197> <WH8799> as an honeycomb <WH5317>, and her mouth <WH2441> is smoother <WH2509> than oil <WH8081>:
But her end <WH319> is bitter <WH4751> as wormwood <WH3939>, sharp <WH2299> as a twoedged <WH6310> sword <WH2719>.
Her feet <WH7272> go down <WH3381> <WH8802> to death <WH4194>; her steps <WH6806> take hold <WH8551> <WH8799> on SH'ol <WH7585>.
Lest thou shouldest ponder <WH6424> <WH8762> the path <WH734> of life <WH2416>, her ways <WH4570> are moveable <WH5128> <WH8804>, that thou canst not know <WH3045> <WH8799> them.
Hear <WH8085> <WH8798> me now therefore, O ye children <WH1121>, and depart <WH5493> <WH8799> not from the words <WH561> of my mouth <WH6310>.
Remove <WH7368> thy way <WH1870> far <WH7368> <WH8685> from her, and come not nigh <WH7126> <WH8799> the door <WH6607> of her house <WH1004>:
Lest thou give <WH5414> <WH8799> thine honour <WH1935> unto others <WH312>, and thy years <WH8141> unto the cruel <WH394>:
Lest strangers <WH2114> <WH8801> be filled <WH7646> <WH8799> with thy wealth <WH3581>; and thy labours <WH6089> be in the house <WH1004> of a stranger <WH5237>;
And thou mourn <WH5098> <WH8804> at the last <WH319>, when thy flesh <WH1320> and thy body <WH7607> are consumed <WH3615> <WH8800>,
And say <WH559> <WH8804>, How have I hated <WH8130> <WH8804> instruction <WH4148>, and my heart <WH3820> despised <WH5006> <WH8804> reproof <WH8433>;
And have not obeyed <WH8085> <WH8804> the voice <WH6963> of my teachers <WH3384> <WH8688>, nor inclined <WH5186> <WH8689> mine ear <WH241> to them that instructed <WH3925> <WH8764> me!
I was almost <WH4592> in all evil <WH7451> in the midst <WH8432> of the congregation <WH6951> and assembly <WH5712>.
Drink <WH8354> <WH8798> waters <WH4325> out of thine own cistern <WH953>, and running waters <WH5140> <WH8802> out of <WH8432> thine own well <WH875>.
Let thy fountains <WH4599> be dispersed <WH6327> <WH8799> abroad <WH2351>, and rivers <WH6388> of waters <WH4325> in the streets <WH7339>.
Let them be only thine own, and not strangers <WH2114> <WH8801> ' with thee.
Let thy fountain <WH4726> be blessed <WH1288> <WH8803>: and rejoice <WH8055> <WH8798> with the wife <WH802> of thy youth <WH5271>.

Let her be as the loving <WH158> hind <WH365> and pleasant <WH2580> roe <WH3280>; let her breasts <WH1717> satisfy <WH7301> <WH8762> thee at all times <WH6256>; and be thou ravished <WH7686> <WH8799> always <WH8548> with her love <WH160>.
And why wilt thou, my son <WH1121>, be ravished <WH7686> <WH8799> with a strange woman <WH2114> <WH8801>, and embrace <WH2263> <WH8762> the bosom <WH2436> of a stranger <WH5237> ?
For the ways <WH1870> of man <WH376> are before <WH5227> the eyes <WH5869> of the YY <WH3068>, and he pondereth <WH6424> <WH8764> all his goings <WH4570>.
His own iniquities <WH5771> shall take <WH3920> <WH8799> the wicked <WH7563> himself, and he shall be holden <WH8551> <WH8735> with the cords <WH2256> of his sins <WH2403>.
He shall die <WH4191> <WH8799> without instruction <WH4148>; and in the greatness <WH7230> of his folly <WH200> he shall go astray <WH7686> <WH8799>.
